author: prestonvanloon
content: Hey everyone, we are considering abandoning ethereumapis and merging it into the Prysm monorepo. We had hoped that it could be a candidate for general adoption, but it doesn't seem to have much interest from anyone other than Prysmatic Labs. If you are a user of ethereumapis, please reach out so we can understand how you might be impacted and offer a smooth migration strategy. Thanks! https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/ethereumapis

author: jgm
content:
It would be great if you could provide the full standard API for a while so it gives client libraries the chance to migrate.

(I'm sure you are aware, but the different licenses between the ethereumapis and prysm repos could cause problems if there isn't a migration path.)
